title: Len Saldua
author: Len Saldua
content: I'm pretty sure this token was over $200 very recently, my exchange has it at just under $100... so why is CoinGecko listing it as a 0.0955 token ? Surely not ? What's more... there's no past history of higher prices, which is untrue. Also listed as N/A in the rankings, whereas before it was ranked around #250 .What happened ?

comments.author: JeffBrad12
comments.body: I just take a link to the new quick swap token on CMC. I think that you shall join on its telegram to see what happened with this token. That's a new token that launched by quick swap dev and this is the site to conver the old token to the new token but i suggest to join int he quick swap telegram group and you can ask the developers about what was the reason by issuing the new token with new contract. As far as i know if that was related with the new product like dragon lair but i can't explain it even further for you https://beta.quickswap.exchange/#/dragonshttps://t.me/QuickSwapDEX

comments.author: masterrex
comments.body: Quote from: Len Saldua on May 11, 2022, 09:59:33 AMI'm pretty sure this token was over $200 very recently, my exchange has it at just under $100... so why is CoinGecko listing it as a 0.0955 token ? Surely not ? What's more... there's no past history of higher prices, which is untrue. Also listed as N/A in the rankings, whereas before it was ranked around #250 .What happened ?Yeah, that's because QuickSwap has redenominated to a 1:1000 ratio and because the total supply has increased that's why the price has also decreased a thousandfold, Anyway, you can compare and check the price below in both tokens. https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/quickswap-old https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/quickswapor you can read it https://quickswap-layer2.medium.com/how-to-convert-your-old-quick-to-new-quick-1000x-your-holdings-9443463290a4
